member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.RequestStateKey.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a request state key from a service realm, consumer key, and an end user id

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.RequestStateKey.#ctor(OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a request state key from a service and an end user id. The service realm is taken to be the OAuthService.Realm property or else the OAuthService.AuthorizationUri if the realm is null. The consumer key is loaded from the service

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.RequestStateKey.ServiceRealm
member.summary: The service realm this state applies to. This could be a HTTP Authorization Realm as per RFC 2616, or some other identifier for a service.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.RequestStateKey.ConsumerKey
member.summary: The consumer key this state applies to.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.RequestStateKey.EndUserId
member.summary: An identifier for the end user this state applies to.

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest
member.summary: Makes a request to an OAuth protected resource.

remarks.para: To create an , use the methods. You should pass a configured which encapsulated the protocol configuration details.
When constructing an , you should pass the request and/or access tokens if you have already performed user authorization.

If a valid access token is supplied, this token will be used to request the protected resource when is called and the returned should contain the resource representation as an . If not, will be false.

If no access token is supplied, but an authorized request token is passed, calling will first request an access token. If successful, the protected resource request will then proceed. The returned will contain the access token obtained in its property and the resource representation as a . will be true.

If no tokens are supplied at all, or if the request token supplied is not authenticated (and no access token is supplied), then the user will be directed to perform authorization of the request. The property will be false. If a request token has been obtained, it will be stored in the property. You should direct the user to the authorization URL as generated by (passing in the request token and optionally a callback URL and/or additional parameters). Once the user has completed the authorization step, you should re-submit the with the now authenticated response token and proceed as above.
If the service provider supports the Problem Reporting extension and an error occurs, a report will be thrown as a . You should use this to inform your response to this error.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.Create(OAuth.Net.Consumer.EndPoint,OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService)
member.summary: Creates a new OAuth protected requests.
member.remarks: Since neither a request token nor an access token is supplied, the user will have to authorize this request.
member.returns: An OAuth protected request for the protected resource

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.Create(OAuth.Net.Consumer.EndPoint,OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService,OAuth.Net.Common.IToken)
member.summary: Creates a new OAuth protected request, initialised with a previously retrieved request token. This token may or may not have been authorized.
member.remarks: If the request token supplied has not been authorized, the user will have to be directed to authorize it before the request can proceed.
member.returns: An OAuth protected request for the protected resource

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.Create(OAuth.Net.Consumer.EndPoint,OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService,OAuth.Net.Common.IToken,OAuth.Net.Common.IToken)
member.summary: Creates a new OAuth protected request, initialised with previously retrieved request and access tokens.
member.remarks: If the access token is valid, the user should not have to intervene to authorize the request and the protected resource should be fetched immediately.
member.returns: An OAuth protected request for the protected resource, initialised with the request token and access token

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.Create(OAuth.Net.Consumer.EndPoint,OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService,System.Uri,OAuth.Net.Common.IToken,OAuth.Net.Common.IToken)
member.summary: Creates a new OAuth protected request, initialised with previously retrieved request and access tokens, the specified callback
member.remarks: If the access token is valid, the user should not have to intervene to authorize the request and the protected resource should be fetched immediately.
member.returns: An OAuth protected request for the protected resource, initialised with the request token and access token

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.Create(OAuth.Net.Consumer.EndPoint,OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService,System.Uri,OAuth.Net.Common.IToken,System.String,OAuth.Net.Common.IToken)
member.summary: Creates a new OAuth protected request, initialised with previously retrieved request and access tokens, the specified callback

member.returns: An OAuth protected request for the protected resource, initialised with the request token and access token

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.DoAuthorizeRequestToken
member.summary: Raises the AuthorizationEventArgs that allows a Consumer to determine if the request should stop and return the RequestToken or continue and request the access token. This allow the a Consumer desktop app to sleep the thread whilst the consumer goes elsewhere to perform the authorization.

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.DoCollectVerifier
member.summary: Raises the AuthorizationVerificationEventArgs that allows a Consumer to provide the verifier received after authorization if it has it.

member.name: E:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.OnBeforeGetRequestToken
member.summary: This event is fired before the request to get a request token is created. You may modify the request Uri and HTTP method, as well as add additional request parameters to be sent with the request in the query string or post body.

member.name: E:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.OnReceiveRequestToken
member.summary: This event is fired after the request token has been received. If an exception occurs receiving the response, this event will not fire.

member.name: E:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.OnBeforeGetAccessToken
member.summary: This event is fired before the request to get an access token is created. You may modify the request Uri and HTTP method.

member.name: E:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.OnReceiveAccessToken
member.summary: This event is fired after the access token has been received. If an exception occurs receiving the response, this event will not fire.

member.name: E:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.OnBeforeGetProtectedResource
member.summary: This event is fired before the request to get the protected resource is created. You may modify the request Uri and HTTP method, as well as add additional request parameters to be sent with the request in the query string or post body.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.ResourceEndPoint
member.summary: The EndPoint for the protected resource

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.ResourceUri
member.summary: The protected resource Uri

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.Service
member.summary: The OAuth service

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.RequestToken
member.summary: The request token

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.AccessToken
member.summary: The access token

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.CallbackUrl
member.summary: The URL that the user is redirected to by the Service Provider. If no Uri is defined the request is defined as out-of-band and the call back has been defined elsewhere or will be performed manually. This value can be dynamically updated during the request by handling the OnBeforeGetRequestToken event in OauthRequest

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.RequestTokenVerifier
member.summary: The verifier parameter provided by the service provider that needs to be returned on the request for the access token.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.VerificationHandler
member.summary: This delegate, if not null, is called before requesting the access token to collect the verifier issued by the service provider.

remarks.para: It is not required to use this mechanism. Instead, you can provide the verifier to .
If you supply a handler, it should attempt to provide the verifier in an application-specific manner when raised.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthRequest.AuthorizationHandler
member.summary: This delegate, if not null, is called when the request token requires authorization.

remarks.para: It is not required to use this mechanism. Instead, you can inspect and direct the user to authorize if false.

If you supply a handler, it should direct the user to authorize in an application-specific manner. If this can be done without aborting the current thread, should be set to true to indicate that the workflow can continue without re-submitting the .
In either mechanism, the authorization URI is built using . If additional parameters are supplied, these will be included in the authorization URI generated.

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService
member.summary: An OAuthService encapsulates protocol information about a set of OAuth endpoints.

remarks.para: An OAuthService contains the following protocol information:

item.description: The URL for obtaining Request Tokens
The URL to send users to for authorization
The URL for obtaining Access Tokens
The HTTP method to use (GET or POST)
Whether Authorization HTTP headers should be used

remarks.para: In future, it should be possible to perform automatic discovery of the protocol information (a discovery specification is being worked on), but for now this information must be supplied.

member.summary: Creates an OAuthService using defaults for most parameters, loading components from the current global service locator.

remarks.para: The OAuthService created will have the following defaults:

member.param: URL to send users to for authorization
member.returns: An OAuthService

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService.BuildAuthorizationUrl(OAuth.Net.Common.IToken)
member.summary: Builds the authorization URL to send a user to for a particular request token. As no callback URL is defined calling this method will force the OAuth Callback to be out-of-band.
member.remarks: If an requires authorization, the URL to send the user to should be built by calling this method, passing in the value.
member.returns: The Uri to send the user to (with the OAuth token parameters encoded)

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService.BuildAuthorizationUrl(OAuth.Net.Common.IToken,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Builds the authorization URL to send a user to for a particular request token, including the additional parameters supplied and the URI for the service provider to return the user to.
member.remarks: If an requires authorization, the URL to send the user to should be built by calling this method, passing in the value.
member.param: Additional parameters to add to the query string
member.returns: The Uri to send the user to (with callback URL & additional parameters added and the OAuth token parameters encoded)

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks whether the supplied object is equal to this OAuthService object.
member.remarks: OAuthServices are compared property by property.
member.returns: true if the objects' properties have the same values; false otherwise

member.summary: Checks whether the supplied OAuthService is equal to this OAuthService object.
member.remarks: OAuthServices are compared property by property (excluding ComponentLocator).
member.returns: true if the OAuthServices' properties have the same values; false otherwise

member.summary: The signature method to use

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService.OAuthVersion
member.summary: The OAuth specification version

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService.Consumer
member.summary: The consumer credentials

member.name: M:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthConsumerRequest.Create(OAuth.Net.Consumer.EndPoint,OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthService)
member.summary: Creates a new OAuth protected requests.
member.remarks: Since neither a request token nor an access token is supplied, the user will have to authorize this request.
member.returns: An OAuth protected request for the protected resource

member.name: T:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthResponse
member.summary: An OAuthResponse is returned when making a request for an OAuthResource from an OAuthService provider. The response will also contain a Token which will either by a RequestToken or AccessToken. If the service has returned the resource in the response then the ProtectedResource will contain the OAuthResource requested.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthResponse.Token
member.summary: The token associated with the resource. In the first stage of the request this will return a RequestToken. When an OAuthResource is succesfully return it will be the AccessToken which can be used for further requests.

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthResponse.HasProtectedResource
member.summary: Returns true if the Response contains the requested OAuthResource

member.name: P:OAuth.Net.Consumer.OAuthResponse.ProtectedResource
member.summary: Returns the OAuthResource requested from the OAuthService if the request was succesfull or null.
